English .
New-York Historical Society
Kurt Boone photographs and pictorial works
Boone, Kurt B.
PR 356
3 Linear feet in one document box and three flat files
2012-2019 The collection includes ten photographic prints by Kurt Boone of subway performers, seven books or booklets of photographs (mostly by Boone) concerning messenger culture and street photography, and seven posters related to Boone's work and bicycling.
Biographical/Historical Note
Kurt Boone was born in Brooklyn, N.Y. in 1959. The New York City-based author, poet, and courier/messenger is known for his work documenting street culture, including graffiti, urban cycling, street performers, subway busking, skateboarding, and spoken word performance.
Arrangement
The collection is organized in two series:
Series I. Photographic Prints
Series II. Other Pictorial Works
Access Restrictions
Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org. Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
Use Restrictions
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to:
Department of Rights and Reproductions The New-York Historical Society 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194 rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org 212-485-9228
Permission to reproduce or quote text from this collection in a publication must be requested from and granted in writing by the Library Director, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194.
Immediate Source of Acquisition Note
Series I: The photographs and posters in folder 1 were gifts of Kurt Boone in 2017. The photographs in folder 2 were purchases from the photographer in 2017 (Rosa Teresa) and 2018 (all others in folder 2).
Series II: Purchased from Kurt Boone in 2019.
Preferred Citation Note
This collection should be cited as Kurt Boone Photographs and Pictorial Works, PR 356, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Credit line for donated photographs: Kurt Boone Photography
Scope and Contents Note
The collection includes ten photographic prints by Kurt Boone (born 1959 in Brooklyn) of subway performers, seven books or booklets of photographs (mostly by Boone) concerning messenger culture and street photography, and seven posters related to Boone's work and cycling.
Processing Information
The initial collection of six photographs was processed by archivist Marybeth Kavanagh in February 2018. An additional four photographs were acquired during 2018 and these were added to the finding aid by archivist Larry Weimer in December 2018. Additional material, which formed Series II, was processed by achivist Larry Weimer in 2019.
Color photographs. Posters. Bicycle messengers. Street entertainers -- New York (State) -- New York. Subway stations -- New York (State) -- New York. Empire State Building (New York, N.Y.) -- Pictorial works.
Series I. Photographic Prints1.5 Linear feetin two flat files2014-2015, 2017
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of ten 16x20" color photographs of subway performers taken by Kurt Boone mostly in 2015 (one was taken in 2014) as part of his "Subway Beats" project. In addition, there are two posters advertising a related 2017 exhibition of Boone's photographs, Music in the Tunnels, held at Quimby's Bookstore in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.
The specific photographs in the collection are itemized in the container list below. Titles, dates and locations used in this finding aid are not found on the photographs themselves, but were provided by Kurt Boone in the collection's transactional documents
Arrangement
The photographs are arranged in the container list alphabetically by title, with posters at the end of the list. Purchased photographs are in a separate folder from donated photographs.Accordion Player20152

Poster features a photo of Rosa Teresa, subway performer.Series II. Other Pictorial Works1.5 Linear feetin one document box and one flat file2012-2019
Arrangement
The series is organized by genre/format.
Scope and Contents
The series primarily includes books or booklets of photographs, most of which are connected with Kurt Boone as photographer or as author of text. The books generally concern street photography, messenger culture, and cycling. There are a few posters, two of which relate to the books, and others relate to film and a film festival centered on cycling. All items are listed in the container list.Book: "NYC Street Portraiture"20191
